intro: Batanthes leucantha, commonly known as the white-flowered batanthes, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are typically opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth texture. Batanthes leucantha is often found in shaded, moist environments such as forest understories.
